months.name: Mirabilis
months.tagline: Beyond the boundary of time, in the hush between cycles, Mirabilis blooms. Here, two sacred breaths—one of fire, one of shadow—meet where neither past nor future holds sway.

months.name: Nivis
months.tagline: From the Latin ‘nix’ meaning snow, Nivis is the breath of winter’s hush, a month where frost writes poetry upon the earth and silence speaks in crystalline whispers.

months.name: Janus
months.tagline: Named for the two-faced Roman god of doorways and transitions, Janus stands at the threshold of past and future, where winds of change stir the soul.

months.name: Brigid
months.tagline: Named for the Celtic goddess of poetry, hearth, and forge, Brigid is the sacred fire of renewal and inspiration, where winter’s chill yields to the first flickers of spring.

months.name: Flora
months.tagline: A tribute to the Roman goddess of blooming flowers and spring’s gentle embrace, Flora is the time when earth awakens in colour, a festival of fragrant renewal.

months.name: Maia
months.tagline: Named for the nurturing Roman goddess of growth, Maia embodies the ripening warmth of spring, her name echoing ‘maius’—greater, larger, the promise of abundance.

months.name: Juno
months.tagline: Honouring the Roman goddess of love and sovereignty, Juno is a month of passion and protection, where devotion burns bright and the sacred feminine reigns supreme.

months.name: Solis
months.tagline: From the Latin ‘sol’ meaning sun, Solis is the golden hour of the year, when the sun stands proud at its peak, bestowing light, life, and radiant joy.

months.name: Terra
months.tagline: Honouring the Roman goddess of the Earth, Terra is a celebration of fertile lands and fruitful harvests, where nature’s generosity spills forth in green abundance.

months.name: Lugh
months.tagline: Named for the Celtic god of light, skill, and craftsmanship, Lugh is a forge of inspiration, where wisdom and fire unite to shape the fate of heroes.

months.name: Pomona
months.tagline: A tribute to the Roman goddess of orchards and fruitfulness, Pomona is a season of rich harvests and whispered abundance, where the earth gifts its sweetest treasures.

months.name: Autumna
months.tagline: From the Latin ‘autumnus’ meaning the fall, Autumna is the golden descent of the year, where leaves turn to fire and the air hums with the poetry of endings.

months.name: Eira
months.tagline: From the Old Norse ‘eyrr’ and Welsh ‘eira’ meaning snow, Eira is the quiet descent of winter’s veil, where frost-kissed dreams whisper of endings and renewal.

months.name: Aether
months.tagline: The celestial breath between earth and sky, Aether is the unseen force of existence, where stardust and spirit intertwine in the spaces between worlds.

special_days.name: Imbolc
special_days.description: Imbolc marks the first signs of spring. It's a time to celebrate the return of life and the arrival of new growth.
special_days.poem:
Imbolc’s fire, a guiding light,
To cleanse the old and spark the bright.
Sweep the hearth and set your aim,
Begin anew in Brigid’s name.

special_days.name: Ostara
special_days.description: Ostara marks the spring equinox. It's a time to celebrate the balance of light and dark and to look ahead to the growth and renewal of spring.
special_days.poem:
Ostara greets the dawn’s bright glow,
As light and dark share equal show.
Plant a seed and watch it grow,
Spring awakens, soft and slow.

special_days.name: Beltane
special_days.description: Beltane marks the beginning of summer. It's a time to celebrate the fertility of the earth and the arrival of new life.
special_days.poem:
Beltane fires in moonlit glade,
Mark love’s embrace and life displayed.
Dance with joy ‘neath skies so wide,
And weave the threads where dreams reside.

special_days.name: Litha
special_days.description: Litha marks the summer solstice. It's a time to celebrate the power of the sun and the longest day of the year.
special_days.poem:
The sun at peak, its golden flame,
On Litha’s day, no dark can claim.
Bathe in light, embrace its glow,
And let your inner fire grow.

special_days.name: Lughnasadh
special_days.description: Lughnasadh marks the beginning of the harvest season. It's a time to give thanks for the abundance of the earth and to prepare for the coming winter.
special_days.poem:
Lughnasadh fields of amber grain,
Give thanks for sun and summer rain.
Share your bread, your heart, your care,
And bless the earth with all you bear.

special_days.name: Mabon
special_days.description: Mabon marks the autumn equinox. It's a time to celebrate the balance of light and dark and to look ahead to the chill of winter.
special_days.poem:
Mabon’s time, the scales now sway,
Equal hours of night and day.
Gather fruits and share the feast,
Celebrate the earth’s increase.

special_days.name: Samhain
special_days.description: This festival marks the end of the harvest season. It's a time to reflect on the past year and honour the ancestors who have come before us.
special_days.poem:
The veil grows thin on Samhain night,
A time for dreams and spirit’s sight.
Light a flame for those once near,
And seek their wisdom, calm and clear.

special_days.name: Yule
special_days.description: Yule marks the winter solstice. It's a time to celebrate the return of the light and the rebirth of the sun.
special_days.poem:
Yule’s bright star in longest night,
Brings hope of dawn and coming light.
Exchange your gifts, sing songs of cheer,
The wheel has turned; new life draws near.

special_days.name: Mirabilis
special_days.description: Mirabilis is a breath held between endings and beginnings—a sacred pause where the wheel stands still. Neither dark nor light, it is the hush between heartbeats, the silence where soul meets sky.
special_days.poem:
Between the dusk and coming light,
Mirabilis blooms in velvet night.
No path to walk, no time to chase,
Just stars and stillness, vast in space.

national_holidays.title: New Year's Day
national_holidays.description: A turning of the cosmic wheel, where time is reborn in shimmering hope and stardust wishes.

national_holidays.title: Martin Luther King Jr. Day
national_holidays.description: A day of dreaming bold and rising strong, when voices echo like thunder for justice and peace.

national_holidays.title: Valentine's Day
national_holidays.description: A heart-shaped spell cast upon the world, where love blooms and passion lingers like rose perfume.

national_holidays.title: Presidents’ Day
national_holidays.description: A reflection on those who shaped the nation's fate—through storms and stillness, with quill and courage.

national_holidays.title: St. Patrick's Day
national_holidays.description: Emerald echoes and laughter rise—today the fae walk among us, cloaked in clover and mirth.

national_holidays.title: Memorial Day
national_holidays.description: A solemn flame flickers for the fallen—where silence speaks of sacrifice and honour rides the breeze.

national_holidays.title: Mother's Day
national_holidays.description: A day wrapped in the soft glow of nurturing spirits, where love flows from root to bloom.

national_holidays.title: Father's Day
national_holidays.description: A tribute to guiding stars—strong, steady, and luminous as ancient oaks in summer’s sun.

national_holidays.title: Juneteenth
national_holidays.description: Chains shattered, spirits freed—Juneteenth rings with ancestral triumph and the fire of freedom.

national_holidays.title: Independence Day
national_holidays.description: Fireworks bloom like celestial flowers in celebration of liberty’s blazing star.

national_holidays.title: Labor Day
national_holidays.description: A sacred pause where hands rest and hearts honour the quiet nobility of work.

national_holidays.title: Columbus Day
national_holidays.description: Voyages remembered beneath a questioning sky—echoes of discovery and reckoning alike.

national_holidays.title: Veterans Day
national_holidays.description: Honour walks among us, cloaked in silence and strength—today we remember the keepers of peace.

national_holidays.title: Thanksgiving Day
national_holidays.description: A harvest of gratitude, where hearths glow with remembrance and blessings flow like mead.

national_holidays.title: Christmas Day
national_holidays.description: A holy hush cloaks the world in wonder, where light returns through stories, stars, and song.

custom_events.title: Hello World, Baby Baby!
custom_events.notes: You took too much, too much....

full_moons.name: Wolf Moon
full_moons.description: Named after the howling of hungry wolves in midwinter, this moon symbolises strength and survival in the coldest time of the year.
full_moons.poem:
In the silent woods, a silver howl rides the wind—
The Wolf Moon rises, fierce and kind.
Through frost and shadow, her courage glows,
A guardian spirit where wildness grows.

full_moons.name: Snow Moon
full_moons.description: Reflecting the heavy snowfall of late winter, the Snow Moon represents the purity and quiet beauty of the season.
full_moons.poem:
Under veils of white, the world lies hushed—
Snow Moon sings in crystal blush.
Her light drifts down in frozen lace,
A gentle spell of silent grace.

full_moons.name: Worm Moon
full_moons.description: Named for the thawing ground and the return of worms, this moon signals the rebirth of the soil as spring approaches.
full_moons.poem:
Earth stirs beneath the Worm Moon’s gaze,
Roots awaken, breaking haze.
Life returns in subtle tune—
A promise sown beneath the moon.

full_moons.name: Pink Moon
full_moons.description: Named for the blooming pink phlox that herald early spring, this moon celebrates renewal and the first flush of colour after winter.
full_moons.poem:
Beneath soft petals, the Pink Moon glows,
Awakening earth where new life grows.
In twilight’s blush, hopes intertwine—
Spring’s tender promise, pure and fine.

full_moons.name: Flower Moon
full_moons.description: Named for the abundance of blooming flowers, this moon symbolises growth and beauty in full swing.
full_moons.poem:
Blossoms bow to the Flower Moon’s delight,
Petals unfurl in fragrant night.
Beauty blooms in every glade—
A tapestry by moonlight made.

full_moons.name: Strawberry Moon
full_moons.description: A tribute to the ripening of strawberries, this moon marks the sweet beginning of summer.
full_moons.poem:
Strawberry Moon in roseate hue,
Ripens fruit and dreams anew.
Sweetness lingers in the air—
A taste of summer everywhere.

full_moons.name: Thunder Moon
full_moons.description: Named for the thunderstorms that mark the beginning of summer, this moon symbolises the power of nature to bring about change.
full_moons.poem:
Thunder Moon beats in fervent drums,
Storm‑lit skies where power hums.
Rainfall cleanses, lightning sings,
Change rides bold on summer wings.

full_moons.name: Grain Moon
full_moons.description: Reflecting the ripening fields of grain, this moon celebrates abundance and gratitude for the first harvest. Also known as Sturgeon Moon.
full_moons.poem:
Amber seas beneath the Grain Moon’s light,
Harvest songs fill up the night.
Gratitude for fields grown gold—
Stories of abundance told.

full_moons.name: Harvest Moon
full_moons.description: The full moon closest to the autumn equinox, the Harvest Moon lights the way for farmers gathering crops late into the night.
full_moons.poem:
Harvest Moon climbs, bold and bright,
Guiding hands through autumn’s night.
Beneath her glow the fields are blessed—
Earth’s generosity confessed.

full_moons.name: Hunter's Moon
full_moons.description: Traditionally aiding hunters in tracking game, this moon symbolises preparation and sustenance.
full_moons.poem:
Hunter’s Moon, a lantern high,
Tracks the quarry through the sky.
Preparation, skill, and lore—
Winter’s promise at the door.

full_moons.name: Frost Moon
full_moons.description: Named for the first frost of the season, this moon marks the transition to winter’s stillness. Also known as Beaver Moon.
full_moons.poem:
Frost Moon weaves a silver thread,
Blankets earth where dreams are spread.
Stillness settles, cold and deep—
The world prepares for winter’s sleep.

full_moons.name: Cold Moon
full_moons.description: Reflecting the chill of winter’s embrace, this moon represents endurance and reflection.
full_moons.poem:
Cold Moon reigns in icy blue,
Endurance shines in all we do.
Reflection calls through darkest night—
Await the sun’s returning light.

zodiac.name: Birch
zodiac.mythical_creature: White Hart - Purity, power, and nobility.

zodiac.name: Rowan
zodiac.animal: Crane - Longevity, wisdom, and spiritual strength.
zodiac.mythical_creature: Dragon - Transformation, growth, and new beginnings.

zodiac.name: Ash
zodiac.mythical_creature: Sea Serpent - Hidden depths and transformation.

zodiac.name: Willow
zodiac.mythical_creature: Hare - Magic, fertility, and new life.

zodiac.name: Hawthorn
zodiac.mythical_creature: Unicorn - Purity, grace, and divine guidance.

zodiac.name: Oak
zodiac.mythical_creature: White Horse - Power, freedom, and victory.

zodiac.name: Hazel
zodiac.mythical_creature: Salmon of Knowledge - Quest for wisdom and understanding.

zodiac.name: Ivy
zodiac.mythical_creature: Faerie - Magic and the hidden realms of nature.
